data.title: Angels seal top spot with thrilling Nam Dinh victory
data.description: Bangkok United finished as Group G winners after they defeated Nam Dinh FC 3-2 in the AFC Champions League Two at Thammasat Stadium on Wednesday night.

data.title: 15% VAT plan has PM vexed
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra has joined a chorus of critics in expressing concern over the Finance Ministry

data.title: Muhammad most popular boys’ baby name in England
data.description: LONDON - Muhammad was the most popular name given to baby boys in England and Wales in 2023, ousting Noah to take the top spot, official figures showed on Thursday.

data.title: Thais nationwide make merit on late king’s birthday
data.description: Thai people across the country made merit and paid their respects on Thursday to the memory of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej the Great on his birthday, which is also National  Father’s Day .

data.title: Customs Department braces for dumping of goods in Thailand, says chief
data.description: More imports likely as a US-China trade war looms in Trump presidency

data.title: Majority of elderly housing projects located in Bangkok and its vicinity
data.description: REIC nationwide survey points to growing demand for elderly housing in urban and economic hubs

data.title: Khlong Prem Prachakorn canal restoration project nears completion
data.description: Interior minister, MEA chief inspect the electrical system alongside the canal to ensure all is set for Prem Prachavanarak Public Park’s royal opening on Dec 10

data.title: New movies out this week: Dec 5-11
data.description: New releases that hit cinemas in Thailand this week.

data.title: Malaysian ex-PM Najib renews home detention bid
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR - Jailed former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak on Thursday mounted a fresh legal bid to serve his remaining prison sentence under house arrest, though court proceedings were cut short to allow prosecutors time to review new evidence.

data.title: ‘Kebaya’ wins Unesco listing after 5-nation bid
data.description: Kebaya , a traditional dress for women in the South, has been declared an intangible cultural heritage item by  Unesco , after being proposed by five countries including Thailand.

data.title: Thailand’s DES Ministry blocks over 178,000 illegal URLs in 14 months
data.description: The ministry is collaborating with internet providers to ensure swift action, with fines imposed on platforms that fail to comply

data.title: Paetongtarn celebrates Father’s Day with dad Thaksin and family
data.description: PM posts pictures with her father and other family members

data.title: VAT increase, flat income tax rate will only burden poor: UNTP MP
data.description: Coalition MP argues that these measures will disproportionately affect low-income earners, raising living costs and reducing purchasing power

data.title: Korean president faces impeachment vote on Saturday
data.description: SEOUL - South Korean opposition lawmakers said on Thursday they would vote this weekend to impeach President  Yoon Suk Yeol  over his botched attempt to impose  martial law , while the defence minister blamed for advising the move resigned.

data.title: Bitcoin soars to $104,000, up 126% since January 1
data.description: The price of Bitcoin hit US$100,000 for the first time in history on Thursday, thanks to demand from Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs), which has led to tightening of supply after Bitcoin’s fourth halving in April and Donald Trump's US election win.

data.title: NACC mulls taking up case querying Thaksin’s preferential treatment
data.description: The case, filed by the National Human Rights Commission, accuses officials of abusing their authority by allowing Thaksin to stay in a VIP hospital suite instead of serving time in prison

data.title: Bangkokians invited to admire Jupiter in ‘Starry Night’ event
data.description: 100 telescopes will be made available for stargazers at Benjakitti Park on Saturday to get a close look at the planet’s clouds, storms and its four Galilean moons

data.title: SRT runs special Bangkok-Chachoengsao train to celebrate Father’s Day
data.description: World War II locomotives pressed into service

data.title: Hilltribe girls ‘lured into selling sex to Chinese customers’
data.description: Two young women have been arrested separately for their alleged involvement in luring 25 underage tribal girls from northern Thailand into selling sex to Chinese customers in Bangkok.

data.title: ALRO investigates VIP land deal in Saraburi
data.description: The investigation follows complaints about the land being misused for non-agricultural purposes, including resort and tourist activities

data.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO kept a low public profile. Then he was shot to death in New York
data.description: Brian Thompson led one of the biggest health insurers in the US but was unknown to millions of people his decisions affected.
